networking.server

Class ServerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • networking.server.ServerHandler

  • public class ServerHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles incoming traffic for one client.
    Initiated by Server
    Run method executed by ServerThread
    Author:
    Bussard30

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception

        Connectivity Check

        First of all it checks if the server is already closed
        and if that's true it closes the Handler

        Deserialization

        First it checks if the queue is empty.
        If not, it's going to read an 32-bit integer,
        which is the length of the incoming packet.
        Then it gets decrypted with the AES key (see key &
        decrypt(SecretKey, byte[])).
        After that it get deserialized (see deserialize(byte[])).

        Interpretation

        Now depending on the type of request/response and/or the type of the object
        a different response will be triggered
        (see Requests and Responses)

        The end

        Now it is being checked if the conditions for advancing
        to the next network phase have been met.
        It also may initiate new requests/responses depending on the network phase.
        (see NetworkPhases)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Wrapper, Request, Requests, Response, Responses, NetworkPhases, Server
